page.title: 19LOCAL GOV.SERVICES, GRIMLEY
page.content: There is no street lighting in Grimley or Sinton Green. The mobile library comes every 1st and 3rd Fri- days of the month. During the summer hedges are trimmed and verges and the Green are mown. The refuse collection takes place on a Friday. There is mains water to most houses. Grimley has septic tank drainage. The roads are in reasonable condi- tion, although few of them have pave- ments so that walking is hazardous, particularly for children. During heavy rain the road near the Post Off- ice in Grimley frequently gets flood- ed, although there are drains where pavements exist. The roads are gritted in icy conditions. There is no recreation ground for children, although impromptu games can be played on Sinton Green.
